This movie is hilarious at points and insightful at others, but overall fairly forgettable. The second and third watchings dull the humour more than just a little bit.If they'd not made 'Scary Movie 2,' and this film held that title, things would have been better. The amount of parody could have been deeper because of greater time between films, and audience interest (namely, my friends' and mine) would have been greater as well. Alas, for that was not to be....On its own (ignoring the '3' in the title), the movie is funny. Again, not laugh-out-loud, watch it sixty times funny, but funny. It delivers hilarious satire of such neo-classics as 'The Ring,' 'Signs,' and '8Mile' to name a few, while also poking fun at the movie industry itself. And Leslie Nielsen's turn as the president is a highlight of the show. However, it falls victim to its own curse: it tries to make a sensible plot out of what should be a romping parody. The whole franchise would be better if they didn't number the titles (i.e., calling them 'Scary Movie,' 'Heck House,' 'General Parody #27G,' and so on would have been better) because numbering the movies and defining them as sequels holds the new movie to expectations it usually can't match.Bottom line: watch 'Scary Movie 3' but don't expect to watch it over and over again like the first movie.

Tom and his brother decide to investigate eventually leading Cindy and the two to meet where they discover the crop circles and the videotape are somehow linked...A lot of people having given this film mixed reviews but I believe that this film isn't bad! Review title: Scary- NO. A Movie- YES. Part 3? YES
Review_body: I came to this film after getting back from the Gulf. I had not seen a film for three years and felt like I needed to unwind a little, as I was pretty stressed as you can probably imagine.I was immediately struck by the charming Anna Faris. Has this girl got the cutest face or what- certainly a change than the desolate looks I had been used to in the preceeding 3 years! I decided to find out more about this young lady and came across an incredible coincidence- she is 17 days older than me! Unbelievable. I might even join a fan club if such a thing exists.Anyway, on to the film itself. It is basically a parody of several films I have not seen, such as Signs, 8 Mile and Ring. I could not comment on the accuracy of the parody but guess it's pretty spot on as people around me were shouting- "its like that bit on Signs!" and other similar stuff. The film is directed with a devil-may-care attitude, jokes are fired at you like bullets from an Iraqi bunker! If there is a problem with the film its probably that many of the jokes will be missed when you are busy laughing at the previous joke, or even the joke before that.Mr Sheen polishes up on laughs in this film, even surpassing his performance in Hot Shots part Deux. He is truly a master of comedy timing, able to wring laughs from even the most jaded cinemagoer- a talent he no doubt perfected during his wilder years.Finally, I feel I must mention Leslie Nielson. I don't want to waste words here- the guy is funny. Thats it. Funny.In summary, the title of the film is 66.6% correct, but that is irrelevant if you want a good laugh. I'm going to watch Jarhead now. See you soon!

It bruoght back the atmosphere of the truly funny spoofs like AIRPLANE, the NAKED GUN trilogy, and HOT SHOTS. This movie is funny or not, depending on the type of comedy you like. Scary Movie 3 is a far cry from those brilliant parodies like Airplane or Naked Gun yet it's still much funnier than the first two movies.  A lot of people were griping over the PG-13 rating but this really doesn't hurt the film.  For the first two, whenever the Wayans brothers reached a creative block, they were like "Well, we'll just blast Cindy with a bodily fluid" and that's where the R rating came from.  In SM3, Zucker moves the script along rather quickly, getting rid of the need for any gratuitous bodily fluid shots.The first half of this film was excellent, when it was parodying The Ring and Signs separately.  It was bogged down by the parody of 8 Mile (a useless scene created simply for the writer to try and make ghetto black people funny to the audience), but for the most part, contained good jokes and (for the first time ever in the series) minor character development.However, once the second half of the film begins and all the storylines begin to merge, the story loses its focus.  It tries too desperately to make the stories coincide while, at the same time, keep the humor.  There are only one or two good jokes in this half (the footage of the aliens will have you cracking up).  Soon, the film is filled with too many undeveloped jokes and useless characters (Macy Gray, anyone?) and all interest is lost. However, the second half of the film actually contains a moment that is, ironically, scary.  Go figure.The talent in this film is, for the most part, pretty good.  Charlie Sheen, Anna Faris and Regina Hall turn in the best performances in the film (Regina Hall, as with the first two movies, steals every scene she's in).  Some excellent comedic talent is found in Leslie Nielsen and Eddie Griffin; however, it is vastly underused and their being in the film feels like a waste.  The only complaint with the cast would have to be Ja Rule, who plays the President's personal Secret Service escort, and whoever the anemic-looking kid playing Cindy's nephew.  These performances were just awful.  This is like "nuclear war" awful.So, yeah, if you want a few good laughs, go see a matinee of this one. It's not worth full price and (considering how much of the trailer didn't make it into the movie) you might want to wait for the DVD instead.

In fact, the film seems to focus too much on the spoofs and not enough on a stable plotline.Right off the bat SM3 feels like a different comedy from its preceders. The jokes focused less on sex, drugs, and gross-outs, and more on slapstick comedy, sight gags, and easter eggs. There were quite a few great laughs it got out of me, but the rest of the jokes got only a smirk or a few chuckles at best. There are countless celebrity cameo's here, some of which add to the laughs, but many of them seem almost completely pointless.The movie overall isn't completely terrible, and by all means go check it out if you're curious. But don't expect to walk out of the theatre satisfied.

Review title: Ok. we have officially hit rock bottom.
Review_body: Ok. we have officially hit rock bottom.I guess I should start off by saying I came out of the theater feeling a bit exploited. We all say how the good moments are in the trailers. Then when we see the movie we are so let down. I never felt suckered into shelling out six bucks until Scary Movie 3.It's major problem is with excess. This movie has too much of everything. There's too many movies parodied. Too many cameos, too many comedy killer jokes(white hood joke, Simon Cowell getting wacked), too many repeated gags. There's a point where they want you to laugh at a million three stooges kung fu fight sequences that go on way too long where you just want to scream "OK I get it already!Move On!"And when the plot decides to lurch forward it seems a little random and arbitrary, sorta like a drunken driver lost and driving a sports car he's never driven before.It's just smacking into one car after another. Sometimes it's plows into garbage bags The movie just keeps rolling out one skit and character after another cutting the good ones short in order to cram some more in.Nothing gets to develop not characters, not the jokes, not even the parody of the movies. It has no true central story to hold it together. Towards the end of its 90(thank you) minutes it throws in the same scenes of ghost slapping and kid smacking, and ball kicking that we already saw before. But of course we're supposed to laugh at it.Aren't We?It's a shame and quite embarrassing that one of the Zucker Bros and Kevin Smith have their names on this. If their was one sentence to describe this movie it would be Airplane on a drug addled bender.

Then in Univercity: she was tricked into going to a mysterious house by her schools' principal to try to find the real business about life after death. But now... there's more.... she is taking care of her nephew who is a physic and likes to spread his visions around. I'm a comedy movie person. Horror movies... nah, creep me out. They also give me too much suspense. This is almost the same with Scary Movie 3, only the suspense isn't that something bad is going to happen, your just on the edge of your seat, ready for the next joke, which comes just at the right time. This movie is honestly one of the funniest things I've seen. With spoofs from The Sixth Sense, Signs, and the Ring, this movie will have you rolling on the floor, dieing of laughter. Despite what some people may say, you don't have to have seen the movie to get the jokes, you do need to know the basic plot of them though. The movie also through in some of Airplane! in there. I watched this at a friends house, and the day I saw it, I went home and ordered it online. Its just that funny. If you don't like comedies, then why are you even reading this? Scary Movie 3 will live in our hearts and minds for ever... unless Scary Movie 4 is better... then Scary Movie 4 will live in our hearts and minds forever... but for now, its all scary movie 3.
